about_the_game:
Zector 7 is a sci-fi zombie survival game set in a world where futuristic technology meets the remnants of modern civilization. As a volunteer in a secret experiment, you awaken in an abandoned facility far into the future, only to discover that the world has been overrun by the undead. The company behind it all, Zector, holds the key to the outbreak—and your survival.

Explore a massive open world filled with advanced technology, hidden alien ruins, and decaying cities. Gather resources, craft weapons, and defend your base from hordes of zombies that attack every night. Use futuristic tools and weapons as you fight your way through increasingly dangerous environments, uncovering the mystery behind Zector’s experiments.

Will you survive long enough to unravel the truth?

Friends or Solo

You can play with up to 10 players or fly solo, it's your call. Currently, the lobby system is pier-to-pier hosting, but I'd like to add dedicated servers eventually.

Also, there is Proximity Chat so you and your friends can fully immersive yourselves if you'd like.

Skills / Levels

  • Earn XP by doing a variety of things including defeating zombies, bandits and wildlife

  • Use your Skill points to increase your stats like stamina, hunger, thirst, health, agility, speed, and much more.

Crafting / Building

  • Craft items, tools, weapons and vehicles

  • Build a base, farm, and more to defend your area, or just relax and get that farm life vibe going.

The Night

The nights are inherently more dangerous for a few reasons.

  • Certain types of enemies only spawn at night

  • More running zombies will spawn at night

  • Unless you've setup lights, it will be hard to see them coming.

  • Temperatures can drop at night

Beacon Towers

For some added adrenaline, you can go active a Beacon Tower, which will summon a large horde. Why do that, you ask? Because those large hordes will have some great loot. Plus, once the Beacon Tower activates, it will spawn a loot box with high tier items inside.

Locations

  • Zectors - sci-fi facilities made by the company Zector. You start off in Zector 3, but you can find the other zector facilities and discover their secrets (and loot)

  • Graveport City - The biggest Old World town in the region. It was the first city to be overrun by the infestation. They blamed their ruin on anyone that embraced newer Technology and vowed to only use Old World tech. Lots of loot (and enemies)

  • Cyber City (still in development)

Biomes

  • Mountain Forest

  • Valley

  • Snow Peak Mountain

  • Desert

  • Desert Warzone

  • More biomes to come

Weather / Day & Night Cycle

  • Dynamic Weather with Sunny, Cloudy, Rainy, Thunderstorms

  • Day & Night cycle

Trade: You can sell items to vendors throughout the world and purchase unique items from them from the credits you have earned like a flashlight attachment for your weapons.

Progression and Customization: Improve your skills and equipment over time. Unlock new abilities using Skills you earn when you Level Up. Level Up in a Skill category by earning XP doing things like killing enemies, crafting and more, depending on the category you want to Level Up. Upgrade your weapons with attachments, get new ones from vendors and other points of interest around the map, and customize your character to suit your playstyle.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-6400 (2.7 GHz 4 Core) / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X (3.5 GHz 4 Core) or equivalent
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 (req. 6GB VRAM) / AMD Radeon RX 580 (req. 6GB VRAM) / Intel ARC A380
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: on board
  • Additional Notes: This is an Early Access game, and minimum specifications may change during development

Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10

  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 2070 Super (req. 6GB VRAM) / AMD Radeon RX 6700 XT (req. 6GB VRAM) / Intel ARC A770
